forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
please don't ask for support for WAREZ, as they WON'T be supported on this forum  

And learn to write in normal characters like anyone else here! :smile:   

Writing in BIGGER characters is pointless, and will only annoy other members.  
Writing in light orange is simply foolish as it is far less visible on a light blue background that "normal" black.  

Learn to post in an appropriate place: what the heck has your question, that you shouldn't have posted at all, have to do with "Downloads", read the sticky here:  
Boot Land \> Groups \> Downloads  
Pinned: Read me first!  
[http://www.boot-land...showtopic=10697](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=10697 "External link")

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> I guess [ubcd](http://www.ultimatebootcd.com/ "External link") or [ubcd4win](http://www.ubcd4win.com/ "External link") would be legit alternatives we could point people to?

Naaah, they're not l33t, they are not cool, you need to actually build UBCD4WIN ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) that's what "they" don't want as it means "work".  

And you don't have access to all that proprietary commercial software, that surely is much better than the same Freeware one.  

Hey, WAREZ are out there, all you need to do is extend your hand and grab them. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

Hiren's has also a nice article in Wikipedia:  
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiren's_BootCD](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiren%27s_BootCD "External link")  

UBCD hasn't:  
[http://en.wikipedia....=...=UBCD\&go=Go](http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&search=UBCD&go=Go "External link")  

UBCD4WIN's one (much worse):  
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UBCD4Win](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UBCD4Win "External link")  

That links to Hiren's just after Winbuilder. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

Now, with the new apporach that allows the glorifying of Hiren's on Winbuilder's board, the circle is closed. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)   

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
For that matter it would be preferible to point folks into our in-house development of LiveXP as it can do and add more features than ubcd4win.  

Or at least make LiveXP available as a setup.exe type of distribution with a nice and clear to understand introduction page as this is something that has always been neglected for some odd reason.  

The point here is that hiren's boot cd is the only thing that a large audience on the Internet seems to know even if they don't require the illegal portion of the included software.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> For that matter it would be preferible to point folks into our in-house development of LiveXP as it can do and add more features than ubcd4win.
The whole point is that UBCD4WIN (though perfectly legal ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)) is a pre-configured BartPE with a number of correctly made plugin, well integrated, i.e. it is a direct corrispondent to the prebuilt WAREZ, in the sense that building it is very easy AND the result is working in 99.99% of cases.  
Thus it is "static" when compared to LiveXP and Winbuilder projects, which also means "foolproof" as opposed to "it won't work unless you get the right combination of builder, .scripts and select them correctly and...".  

> Or at least make LiveXP available as a setup.exe type of distribution with a nice and clear to understand introduction page as this is something that has always been neglected for some odd reason.
Question: Ever wondered WHY I always pointed **ONLY** to **amalux** 's pre-packed builds? :smile:  
Answer: Because it is the **ONLY** product of Winbuilder that a newcomer can build successfully in most cases.  

> The point here is that hiren's boot cd is the only thing that a large audience on the Internet seems to know even if they don't require the illegal portion of the included software.
Well, no.  
The point here is that "we" know, and "we" should tell "them". ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)  

The fact that Hiren's is "mixed" with Winbuilder or UBCD4WIN is not a good thing, as I see it. :smile:  

:smile:  
Wonko

forumNotes.content:
If we let the legal part aside for a bit, i have to say that it would be a pretty tall oder, if someone would ask us to create a project that could replicate some of the premade PEs, feature wise.  
Legal or not, those guys are good!  

![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)

> Thus it is "static" when compared to LiveXP and Winbuilder projects, which also means "foolproof" as opposed to "it won't work unless you get the right combination of builder, .scripts and select them correctly and...".
Hi jaclaz,  

maybe you missed,  
to avoid things (right wb version, right scripts etc. etc.), LiveXP-Recommended.zip very frequently updated (last update 2010-04-06 , please ignore date on page :smile: )  
[http://winbuilder.ne...oad.php?view.35](http://winbuilder.net/download.php?view.35 "External link")  

> Or at least make LiveXP available as a setup.exe type of distribution with a nice and clear to understand introduction page as this is something that has always been neglected for some odd reason.
I do not know the reason why it would be better to have .exe instead of .zip ... , sure I would prefer .7z sfx to make it smaller **BUT** so far nobody have trouble with extracting .zip and make a successfull initial build for a looooooooong time. Progress, as usual, continues with other requests and enhancements.  

> Question: Ever wondered WHY I always pointed **ONLY** to **amalux** 's pre-packed builds? ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)
I also point amalux's prepacked builds too. But my answer is different. I feel you never (at least since I come to boot-land) downloaded them. ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)

I agree, besides Hiren having a pe1 inside with win32 applications, it is the only famous dos based boot cd project I know which with a couple of reasons (except being warez + ready .iso) makes it very well known. I always wonder why jaclaz (or others) did not start a legit dos based builder project with a set of batch or etc. :smile:   

:smile:

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> Hi jaclaz, > > maybe you missed, > to avoid things (right wb version, right scripts etc. etc.), LiveXP-Recommended.zip very frequently updated (last update 2010-04-06 , please ignore date on page ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png) ) > [http://winbuilder.ne...oad.php?view.35](http://winbuilder.net/download.php?view.35 "External link") I rarely miss something :smile:, it's you that missed the point. "We" managed to have a visible download link to Winbuilder only a few days ago. The use of "recommended LiveXp" for newcomers should be all over boot-land (and it wasn't last time I checked). The home page [http://winbuilder.ne...oad.php?view.35](http://winbuilder.net/download.php?view.35 "External link") SUCKS. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Compare it with that of UBCD4WIN: [http://www.ubcd4win.com/](http://www.ubcd4win.com/ "External link") There are FAQ's: [http://www.ubcd4win.com/faq.htm](http://www.ubcd4win.com/faq.htm "External link") There is a LIST of the tools inside: [http://www.ubcd4win.com/contents.htm](http://www.ubcd4win.com/contents.htm "External link") There is a "howto": [http://www.ubcd4win.com/howto.htm](http://www.ubcd4win.com/howto.htm "External link") [http://www.ubcd4win.com/burn.htm](http://www.ubcd4win.com/burn.htm "External link") [http://www.ubcd4win.com/custom.htm](http://www.ubcd4win.com/custom.htm "External link") [http://www.ubcd4win.com/slipstream.htm](http://www.ubcd4win.com/slipstream.htm "External link") Now, try playing "first time user" which one would you like to receive as advice? :smile: Please choose one: * A well detailed project with detailed explanation of what it contains and how to create it * A project described as " based on Windows XP PE environment. It will produce a boot disk that allows you to have explorer as shell, MMC, access to most SATA drives, and network connectivity." with no other info but a bunch of links leading to "winbuilder related things" (out of the sphere of inteerest and knowledge of the newcomer) and to this Forum, where a newcomer will easyly loose himself.
Oww, come on.... ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)
> I feel you never (at least since I come to boot-land) downloaded them. ![:rofl:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/roll1.gif) And ...? ![:rofl:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/roll1.gif)
> I always wonder why jaclaz (or others) did not start a legit dos based builder project with a set of batch or etc. :smile: Because there is ALREADY UBCD, which is good enough. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Wonko

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
> I do not know the reason why it would be better to have .exe instead of .zip
In terms of unzipping doesn't bring advantages but a setup can do a whole lot more than just that.  

It can add an icon on the desktop and start menu. This make the whole install process a lot more comfortable and "safe" for new users.  

About the site for LiveXP, I think [http://livexp.winbuilder.net](http://livexp.winbuilder.net "External link") could be used for that.  

Instead of using a static site, we could add a wiki like approach using TiddlyWiki which can run from either the server or directly from any personal computer without internet connection.  

In fact, tiddly wiki even seems like a good replacement for our current help pages used on winbuilder since it would be possible to make it available as a standalone document for anyone interested.  

[http://en.wikipedia....wiki/TiddlyWiki](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TiddlyWiki "External link")

forumNotes.content:

just to write a sentence for current topic:  
hiren is the most famous, well known warez I know ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png) . Better to understand the reasons behind except it being warez. ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
> This is FAR out of current topic,
We are discussing why LiveXP doesn't have it's own web page. If it's too much work for LiveXP developers to work on it, let the fans help.  

> I do not care how famous or well known LiveXP is or not.
Yes, that could also be a reason to explain why people know hiren or ubcd4win and forget LiveXP.  

Just wish it wasn't like that.

forumNotes.author: Lancelot
forumNotes.content:
> We are discussing why LiveXP doesn't have it's own web page. No we are not discussing that. (at least I am not). I only replied to jaclaz comment "it won't work unless you get the right combination of builder, .scripts and select them correctly and...". reminding him the solution we produce which so far success. Than jaclaz comment on how well organised infos provided by other distributions..... (which was not my point) Than as usual you brought why LiveXP doesn't have it's own page. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) > If it's too much work for LiveXP developers to work on it, let the fans help. fans already help, we have King amalux's [Wonderful tutorial](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=4111 "External link") and I remember personal pages around having introductions for LiveXP..... > **Super** **Amalux's** **Wonderful** tutorial ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png) (King Amalux=King of the LiveXP tutorials) > Yes, that could also be a reason to explain why people know hiren or ubcd4win and forget LiveXP. I wish it was not like that too. If you think this is because of missing pages or etc, than you are truely missing a biiiiiiiiiig point which have nothing to discuss at current topic. Simple Internet Reality is: If something is really good, than don't worry, people on internet will find you even if you write in None-English on a None-English website with a simple post topic. (None-English=Russian, Chinese, Japanese, Taiwan, .... even Turkish :smile:) So far increasing number of people come and find LiveXP, and made tutorials on their webpages etc. Please do NOT change the subject from Hiren to LiveXP. As I wrote **I NEVER write LiveXP as an alternative** neither to Hiren, nor to BartPE, UBCD, UBCDWin, BartPE, Sherpya-XPE .... If a user ask me "how to obtain a quick rescue cd", I would advice UBCDwin , UBCD and Hiren. If a user **have time** , than I would also advice learn LiveXP ![:rofl:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/roll1.gif) which I am sure (s)he will spend very good time ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)
**Going back to subject of the topic:** As far as I remember, Hiren did not advertise himself through topics all over net etc. Instruction on its webpage is basic level of writing cd, creating ufd bootable and ingredients. (LiveXP do not need cd write tutorial since it has imgburn inside which executes at the end asking to write cd + we have more proper methods \& tutorial to make bootable ufd on boot-land (ps: I always avoid making a script to prevent user blow up their ufd, following tutorials and tools of boot-land is already more proper \& secure) + Ingredient of LiveXP always available [http://livexp.boot-land.net](http://livexp.boot-land.net "External link") ) Hiren do not have tutorials to instruct end user how to use the tools inside etc. Hiren become more and more popular through years, hence there are lots of instructions and tutorials on multilanguage forums around the world. Reason is simple, Hiren is **very good** for a set of reasons. (I also do not like people asking things about Hiren on boot-land, not because it is warez, If they could use google they could already find answers for their questions, only some lazy guys come around time to time) This is not about Hiren only being Warez. There are lots of WAREZ distributions around with name Dark, Super, Hyper etc... and NONE of them is as famous as Hiren. Here jaclaz made a good instruction about finding warez. [http://www.boot-land...showtopic=10984](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=10984 "External link") But even jaclaz did not say writing "Hiren" on google is a way of finding warez :smile: . It is the name "Hiren", noooooooo. It is simple, Hiren is **very good** . If Hiren initially had a name "Tomatho" it will again will be as popular as today. BartPE, UBCDWIN, Reatogo and SherpyaXPE are **very good** legit alternatives, Hence you can find lots of instructions and tutorials on multilanguage forums all around the world. There are lots personal pebuilder plugin (=BartPE, UBCDWIN, Reatogo and SherpyaXPE) pages (legit \& unlegit) that distributes a loooot of nice stuff. There are forums dedicated these plugins hence well organised, like the one on 911 [http://www.911cd.net...hp?showforum=30](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showforum=30 "External link") Even today new projects based on pebuilder being created like [TeutonPE](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=10812 "External link"), and I do not think Bart Lagerweij himself work on all these stuff himself. :smile: Simple fact, pebuilder is **very good** . And if something is **very good** , do not worry, people come and find you, hence make tutorials, instructions, contributions etc. etc. Comparing: To me LiveXP getting better and better, hence being more popular slowly with Galapo's great wisdom. Besides I do not care how much popularity (or well known) it has. LiveXP will NATURALLY get more popular with the continuation of its progress. I do not care when (or if) it will happen or if it can have a degree to get comparable level to above distributions. Life goes and we will see. Basicly The day LiveXP becomes **very good** from all level of end user, than it will, if not than who cares, but it will still have lovers on some level ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) . I know my post will %95 not be replied properly as usual, for end words: I highly respect success of at most BartPE (and Bart Lagerweij for his wisdom), than SherpyaXP, Reatogo, UBCD, UBCDWin and Hiren. Anyone who have a goal to make something popular should **understand** the reason behind their success. ![:rofl:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/roll1.gif)

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
> I NEVER write LiveXP as an alternative
Too bad, I just wish it was.

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
The reason that HirensCD is better known than LiveXP is simple.  
People who do not have to spend time building and learning, have time to write posts! ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)  

![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> I know my post will %95 not be replied properly as usual, for end words:
Good, that allows me to reply to the 5%:  
> Hiren do not have tutorials to instruct end user how to use the tools inside etc.
for the simple reason that 95% of the people that get it are so damn lazy they won't ever learn to use them!  

* Hiren's is "easiest" with lots of applications pre-added. Needs not to read anything. It is pre-built. Success in building 100%. Success in booting 99.99%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 0
* UBCD4WIN is "easier" with lots of applications pre-added. Needs to read very few things, CLEARLY written and EASILY accessible. Needs to be built, but still easy. Success in building 95%. Success in booting 90%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 1
* **amalux**'s frozen built is "easy" with many applications pre-added.Needs to read very few things, substantially clearly written and and relatively easily accessible. Needs to be built, but still easy. Success in building 95%. Success in booting 90%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 2
* BartPE (normal but with applications added). Needs to read LOTS of things, UNclearly written and UNeasily accessible.Needs to be built, and it is OVERLY complex. Success in building, maybe 40%. Success in booting 35%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 8
* LiveXP (normal but with applications added). is "difficult". Needs to read LOTS of things, UNclearly written and UNeasily accessible.Needs to be built, and it is OVERLY complex. Success in building, maybe 30%. Success in booting 25%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 10

Obviously I simply faked the percentages ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif), just to convey the idea, people uses naturally Occam's Razor, and always chooses the easiest path or the one that gives more advantages.  

Evidently it's just me that is overlaying the above with "morals" or "ethics", and striking out Hiren's as a not viable solution.  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.content:
> I guess [ubcd](http://www.ultimatebootcd.com/ "External link") or [ubcd4win](http://www.ubcd4win.com/ "External link") would be legit alternatives we could point people to?

And you don't have access to all that proprietary commercial software, that surely is much better than the same Freeware one.  

Hey, WAREZ are out there, all you need to do is extend your hand and grab them. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
For that matter it would be preferible to point folks into our in-house development of LiveXP as it can do and add more features than ubcd4win.  

Or at least make LiveXP available as a setup.exe type of distribution with a nice and clear to understand introduction page as this is something that has always been neglected for some odd reason.  

The point here is that hiren's boot cd is the only thing that a large audience on the Internet seems to know even if they don't require the illegal portion of the included software.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> For that matter it would be preferible to point folks into our in-house development of LiveXP as it can do and add more features than ubcd4win.
The whole point is that UBCD4WIN (though perfectly legal ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)) is a pre-configured BartPE with a number of correctly made plugin, well integrated, i.e. it is a direct corrispondent to the prebuilt WAREZ, in the sense that building it is very easy AND the result is working in 99.99% of cases.  
Thus it is "static" when compared to LiveXP and Winbuilder projects, which also means "foolproof" as opposed to "it won't work unless you get the right combination of builder, .scripts and select them correctly and...".  

> Or at least make LiveXP available as a setup.exe type of distribution with a nice and clear to understand introduction page as this is something that has always been neglected for some odd reason.
Question: Ever wondered WHY I always pointed **ONLY** to **amalux** 's pre-packed builds? :smile:  
Answer: Because it is the **ONLY** product of Winbuilder that a newcomer can build successfully in most cases.  

> The point here is that hiren's boot cd is the only thing that a large audience on the Internet seems to know even if they don't require the illegal portion of the included software.
Well, no.  
The point here is that "we" know, and "we" should tell "them". ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)  

The fact that Hiren's is "mixed" with Winbuilder or UBCD4WIN is not a good thing, as I see it. :smile:  

:smile:  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
> I do not know the reason why it would be better to have .exe instead of .zip
In terms of unzipping doesn't bring advantages but a setup can do a whole lot more than just that.  

It can add an icon on the desktop and start menu. This make the whole install process a lot more comfortable and "safe" for new users.  

About the site for LiveXP, I think [http://livexp.winbuilder.net](http://livexp.winbuilder.net "External link") could be used for that.  

Instead of using a static site, we could add a wiki like approach using TiddlyWiki which can run from either the server or directly from any personal computer without internet connection.  

In fact, tiddly wiki even seems like a good replacement for our current help pages used on winbuilder since it would be possible to make it available as a standalone document for anyone interested.  

[http://en.wikipedia....wiki/TiddlyWiki](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TiddlyWiki "External link")

forumNotes.author: Lancelot
forumNotes.content:
> We are discussing why LiveXP doesn't have it's own web page. No we are not discussing that. (at least I am not). I only replied to jaclaz comment "it won't work unless you get the right combination of builder, .scripts and select them correctly and...". reminding him the solution we produce which so far success. Than jaclaz comment on how well organised infos provided by other distributions..... (which was not my point) Than as usual you brought why LiveXP doesn't have it's own page. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) > If it's too much work for LiveXP developers to work on it, let the fans help. fans already help, we have King amalux's [Wonderful tutorial](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=4111 "External link") and I remember personal pages around having introductions for LiveXP..... > **Super** **Amalux's** **Wonderful** tutorial ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png) (King Amalux=King of the LiveXP tutorials) > Yes, that could also be a reason to explain why people know hiren or ubcd4win and forget LiveXP. I wish it was not like that too. If you think this is because of missing pages or etc, than you are truely missing a biiiiiiiiiig point which have nothing to discuss at current topic. Simple Internet Reality is: If something is really good, than don't worry, people on internet will find you even if you write in None-English on a None-English website with a simple post topic. (None-English=Russian, Chinese, Japanese, Taiwan, .... even Turkish :smile:) So far increasing number of people come and find LiveXP, and made tutorials on their webpages etc. Please do NOT change the subject from Hiren to LiveXP. As I wrote **I NEVER write LiveXP as an alternative** neither to Hiren, nor to BartPE, UBCD, UBCDWin, BartPE, Sherpya-XPE .... If a user ask me "how to obtain a quick rescue cd", I would advice UBCDwin , UBCD and Hiren. If a user **have time** , than I would also advice learn LiveXP ![:rofl:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/roll1.gif) which I am sure (s)he will spend very good time ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)
**Going back to subject of the topic:** As far as I remember, Hiren did not advertise himself through topics all over net etc. Instruction on its webpage is basic level of writing cd, creating ufd bootable and ingredients. (LiveXP do not need cd write tutorial since it has imgburn inside which executes at the end asking to write cd + we have more proper methods \& tutorial to make bootable ufd on boot-land (ps: I always avoid making a script to prevent user blow up their ufd, following tutorials and tools of boot-land is already more proper \& secure) + Ingredient of LiveXP always available [http://livexp.boot-land.net](http://livexp.boot-land.net "External link") ) Hiren do not have tutorials to instruct end user how to use the tools inside etc. Hiren become more and more popular through years, hence there are lots of instructions and tutorials on multilanguage forums around the world. Reason is simple, Hiren is **very good** for a set of reasons. (I also do not like people asking things about Hiren on boot-land, not because it is warez, If they could use google they could already find answers for their questions, only some lazy guys come around time to time) This is not about Hiren only being Warez. There are lots of WAREZ distributions around with name Dark, Super, Hyper etc... and NONE of them is as famous as Hiren. Here jaclaz made a good instruction about finding warez. [http://www.boot-land...showtopic=10984](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=10984 "External link") But even jaclaz did not say writing "Hiren" on google is a way of finding warez :smile: . It is the name "Hiren", noooooooo. It is simple, Hiren is **very good** . If Hiren initially had a name "Tomatho" it will again will be as popular as today. BartPE, UBCDWIN, Reatogo and SherpyaXPE are **very good** legit alternatives, Hence you can find lots of instructions and tutorials on multilanguage forums all around the world. There are lots personal pebuilder plugin (=BartPE, UBCDWIN, Reatogo and SherpyaXPE) pages (legit \& unlegit) that distributes a loooot of nice stuff. There are forums dedicated these plugins hence well organised, like the one on 911 [http://www.911cd.net...hp?showforum=30](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showforum=30 "External link") Even today new projects based on pebuilder being created like [TeutonPE](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=10812 "External link"), and I do not think Bart Lagerweij himself work on all these stuff himself. :smile: Simple fact, pebuilder is **very good** . And if something is **very good** , do not worry, people come and find you, hence make tutorials, instructions, contributions etc. etc. Comparing: To me LiveXP getting better and better, hence being more popular slowly with Galapo's great wisdom. Besides I do not care how much popularity (or well known) it has. LiveXP will NATURALLY get more popular with the continuation of its progress. I do not care when (or if) it will happen or if it can have a degree to get comparable level to above distributions. Life goes and we will see. Basicly The day LiveXP becomes **very good** from all level of end user, than it will, if not than who cares, but it will still have lovers on some level ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) . I know my post will %95 not be replied properly as usual, for end words: I highly respect success of at most BartPE (and Bart Lagerweij for his wisdom), than SherpyaXP, Reatogo, UBCD, UBCDWin and Hiren. Anyone who have a goal to make something popular should **understand** the reason behind their success. ![:rofl:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/roll1.gif)

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> I know my post will %95 not be replied properly as usual, for end words:
Good, that allows me to reply to the 5%:  
> Hiren do not have tutorials to instruct end user how to use the tools inside etc.
for the simple reason that 95% of the people that get it are so damn lazy they won't ever learn to use them!  

* Hiren's is "easiest" with lots of applications pre-added. Needs not to read anything. It is pre-built. Success in building 100%. Success in booting 99.99%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 0
* UBCD4WIN is "easier" with lots of applications pre-added. Needs to read very few things, CLEARLY written and EASILY accessible. Needs to be built, but still easy. Success in building 95%. Success in booting 90%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 1
* **amalux**'s frozen built is "easy" with many applications pre-added.Needs to read very few things, substantially clearly written and and relatively easily accessible. Needs to be built, but still easy. Success in building 95%. Success in booting 90%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 2
* BartPE (normal but with applications added). Needs to read LOTS of things, UNclearly written and UNeasily accessible.Needs to be built, and it is OVERLY complex. Success in building, maybe 40%. Success in booting 35%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 8
* LiveXP (normal but with applications added). is "difficult". Needs to read LOTS of things, UNclearly written and UNeasily accessible.Needs to be built, and it is OVERLY complex. Success in building, maybe 30%. Success in booting 25%. Level of difficulty (and stress) = 10

Obviously I simply faked the percentages ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif), just to convey the idea, people uses naturally Occam's Razor, and always chooses the easiest path or the one that gives more advantages.  

Evidently it's just me that is overlaying the above with "morals" or "ethics", and striking out Hiren's as a not viable solution.  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
I think you've missed one point.  
All the legal CD can't be tested without first putting work in. So people are basicly asked to 'buy' the cat in the sack. People really hate to invest time, work and money into something, they're not even sure yet, they want.  
I think, if people could first test a prebuild CD, more people would come around to build own 'better' versions afterwards.  

Another thing about this leagl not legal stuff.  
Software is protected by copyright, just like a book. If i can go to a public library and lend any book, i like, for free, why can't i do the same with software?  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> Software is protected by copyright, just like a book. If i can go to a public library and lend any book, i like, for free, why can't i do the same with software?
Well, unless you are the Library mantainer you can only BORROW a book, and the Library LENDS it to you:  
[http://www.thefreedictionary.com/lend](http://www.thefreedictionary.com/lend "External link")  
[http://www.thefreedi...nary.com/borrow](http://www.thefreedictionary.com/borrow "External link")  

The "key" of both practices is that the object is returned.  
Usually a fee (forfait or pro-quota) is due for the use you make of it. (The fact that the library is public means that you pay for it in your taxes)  
A penalty is applied if the object doesn't return in the established terms.  

In the specific case of the library there is a physical object that can be read (normally) by one single person at the time.  

Try going to the Library and ask if you can photocopy a whole Copyright protected book (using their photocopier and paper) and distribute the copies to your friends. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

The general idea of "**Copyright"** is that you cannot make any **Copy** of it and distribute/publish it unless an agrement has been reached with the Author, or anyway the **right** s holder.  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
> The "key" of both practices is that the object is returned. Of course i would return the CD, what do you think of me? ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) > In the specific case of the library there is a physical object that can be read (normally) by one single person at the time. Like a CD you mean? ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) > Try going to the Library and ask if you can photocopy a whole Copyright protected book (using their photocopier and paper) and distribute the copies to your friends. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) When i studied, we wrote down whole pages of books. When my daughter studied times had moved on and she photocopied whole pages. No problem. And before you ask, yes it was custom, that if all needed the exact same info, only one went to the library and made the copies for the whole group. We used to pay in such cases a secretary to make copies for us. > The general idea of "**Copyright"** is that you cannot make any **Copy** of it and distribute/publish it unless an agrement has been reached with the Author, or anyway the **right**s holder. As said before, until computers came along, we here in Germany had the right of the private copy **without exception** . And nobody complained! As long as i didn't sell it or went into serial production, it was fine. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) In practice this meant, that i could make as many copies as i like, using usual home resources.
Read by the way a nice article a while ago, comparing the point of view on private copies in the analog age versus the digital age. The point it made in an interview with a music producer, was that a mp3 today, is viewed just as much as an inferior copy like tapes where back then. The real problem comes from the fact, that the people these days are far less quality conscious then back then. Nobody would have not bought the record, just because he had the song taped from radio. These days, if people have the mp3, they don't buy the CD. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:

Yep. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.content:
> Do you guys and gals consider Shardana Antivirus Rescue Disk Utility (SARDU), which can create either a boot cd or a boot usb easily, as a warez ?  
> (just for convenience the site is here: [SarduCD.it](http://www.sarducd.it/ "External link"))  
> I don't promote this tool, I'm just interested in your thoughts on this. ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)

Sardu is a tool, just like a kitchen knife can be used to cook dinner or become a murder weapon depending on the hands that hold it.  

Therefore, the proper or improper intention of using this tool depends solely on the intentions of the end-user.   

On Boot Land, we prefer to see the kitchen knife as cooking utensil and Sardu as a very useful tool, if you plan to use it for handling warez then this is not the proper place to discuss it.  

We know Sardu quite well, in fact, the official forums are right here on Boot Land: [http://www.boot-land...p?showforum=100](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=100 "External link")  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: MB_75
forumNotes.content:
Hi,  

Must say this was interessting reading... I would say the reason Hirens become so popular, was the fact that there was so much tools available on the disk and "helped" a lot of people in certain situations. There is a lot of people that "cannot affort" most of the sofware on this build, so way not using Hirens???  

W.r.t. the boot capability of Hirens, well it's not that great ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) . I used Hirens a lot in the past, but run in so much issues booting a PC especially if it's a new board set to ACHI and the CD drive is SATA. It almost always failing loading the CD.   

Then the light come on and I found Boot-land ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)   

Why would I waist my time trying to get Hirens booted if I can boot in a Windows enviroment??? That's why I love the Win7PE project. There is not a lot of systems you cannot boot and access the resources. Adding drivers is also a breeze.  

There were also a lot of discussion about the ease of use of projects like LiveXP etc to newbies. Well, this can be solved quite easily... The huge amount of knowledge on this forums, can solve this. On each project, there should be some sort of BASE build. This is basic thing that if executed "out-of-the-box" it should work. This will build the newbies confidence and should trigger their grey juices and hooked into one or more of the projects and contribute...  

Then with the legal issues, well there is a LOT of freeware programs on the Hirens image. Why not use them? They are available in one place, only need to extract them and add them to the project. Then there is no issue. Just leave the illegal stuff alone and don't use them...  

Just though to give my 10c worth.  

Regards,   

**Edited by MB_75, 14 December 2010 - 08:44 PM.**
